channel.title: Maths on Tim Holzschuh
channel.description: Recent content in Maths on Tim Holzschuh

item.title: Étale Cohomology I
item.description: During the winter term in 2023, I’m TAing the course Étale Cohomology I by Prof. Alexander Schmidt. The exercise sheets will be accessible through the relevant Mampf course, and will be discussed in the exercise session of the subsequent week: When? Thursday, 11:00 am Where? SR3 Contact: tholzschuh [at] mathi [dot] uni-heidelberg [dot] de You won’t have to hand in written solutions to the exercises, but I strongly encourage you to spend a fair amount of time thinking about them in order to get the most out of the exercise sessions.

item.title: GAUS AG: Applications of the étale fundamental gerbe to anabelian geometry
item.description: Together with Jakob Stix and Marcin Lara I’m organizing a GAUS-AG on the use of the étale fundamental gerbe in anabelian geometry. A detailed programme can be found tba. When? Roughly every two weeks on Wednesday. Where? We’re rotating between Heidelberg and Frankfurt. Check out the programme for specific dates and places. Contact: tholzschuh[at]mathi.uni-heidelberg.de lara[at]math.uni-frankfurt.de stix[at]math.uni-frankfurt.de

item.title: Galois Cohomology II
item.description: During the summer term in 2023, together with Marius Leonhardt I’m creating the exercises and TAing the course Galois Cohomology II held by Dr. Alessandro Cobbe. The exercise sheets will be accessible through the relevant Mampf course on Thursdays, and will be discussed in the exercise session of the subsequent week: When? Wednesday, 2:00 pm Where? SR6 Contact: tholzschuh@mathi.uni-heidelberg.de You won’t have to hand in written solutions to the exercises, but I strongly encourage you to spend a fair amount of time thinking about them in order to get the most out of the exercise sessions.

item.title: Galois Cohomology I
item.description: During the winter term in 2022, I’m TAing the course Galois Cohomology I by Prof. Alexander Schmidt. The exercise sheets will be accessible through the relevant Mampf course on Wednesdays, and will be discussed in the exercise session of the subsequent week: When? Wednesday, 2:00 pm Where? SR3 First session: 26.10. Contact: tholzschuh@mathi.uni-heidelberg.de You won’t have to hand in written solutions to the exercises, but I strongly encourage you to spend a fair amount of time thinking about them in order to get the most out of the exercise sessions.

item.title: The Grothendieck conjecture for affine curves
item.description: Together with Jakob Stix I’m organizing a GAUS-AG on Tamagawa’s seminal paper The Grothendieck conjecture for affine curves. A detailed programme can be found here. When? Roughly every two weeks on Wednesday. Where? We’re rotating between Heidelberg and Frankfurt. Check out the programme for specific dates and places. Contact: tholzschuh[at]mathi.uni-heidelberg.de stix[at]math.uni-frankfurt.de

item.title: Galois and Fundamental Groups
item.description: Together with Marius Leonhardt I’m supervising a seminar on Galois and fundamental groups. The announcement (in german) is here. If you’re interested, subscribe via MÜSLI or send us an email. When? Thursdays, 02:15pm - 03:45pm Where? Mathematikon, SR 6 (Group A) and SR 7 (Group B) Contact: tholzschuh[at]mathi.uni-heidelberg.de mleonhardt[at]mathi.uni-heidelberg.de Handouts of all the talks can be found MaMpf.
